entityId.localType: State Library of South Australia Archival Number

nameEntry.part: Vida Merle Maney interviewed by Adair Dunsford for the Honoured Women Oral History Project

biogHist.abstract: Vida Merle Maney was born in Naracoorte in 1935. She was awarded the Medal of the Order of Australia (OAM) in 1991, and was interviewed as part of the Honoured Women Oral History Project in 1999. Her interview includes a description of her time as a child at the Somerton Crippled Children's Home.
biogHist.p: Researchers can have access to documents, photographs, recordings and transcripts held at the State Library of South Australia on presenting their Readers Ticket. Readers Tickets are available from the Library. Records, recordings and transcripts can only be used in the Somerville Reading Room and are not available for borrowing.
Access to some material at the State Library may require written permission from the person or organisation that deposited the records.
The interview runs 1hr 58mins and is available on sound cassette (2 tapes). A full pdf transcript of 31 pages is also available online. To access the pdf transcript please use the link above.
This interview forms part of the J.D. Somerville Oral History Collection.
